hypothesis_content.title: Exchange Reserve Depletion Signals Imminent Volatility & Liquidity Scramble
hypothesis_content.statement: When aggregate BTC exchange reserves (Glassnode) drop by >50k BTC in 7 days during a NEUTRAL regime, it indicates accumulation and a reduction of immediately sellable supply. This creates a liquidity vacuum that amplifies price movement on the next significant volume spike (>1.5x 20-day avg), providing a volatility breakout opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Rapid withdrawal from exchanges reduces readily available sell-side liquidity. The market becomes brittle—large orders execute at increasingly worse prices. The first significant volume spike after this depletion tends to cause exaggerated moves as liquidity is sought.
entry_conditions: 7-day net change in BTC exchange reserves < -50,000 BTC
BTC price trading in 10% range for past 10 days (compression)
Next 4h candle volume > 1.5x 20-period moving average of volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% move in direction of breakout (long if breaks range high, short if breaks low) OR volatility expansion (ATR 1-day increase > 50%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: False breakout: price returns to prior range midpoint within 12h of breakout candle close
exit_conditions.time_exit: 48 hours after entry if no clear directional move (<3% from entry)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Reserves drop significantly but price remains range-bound on elevated volume for >5 days, indicating orderly absorption without a volatility spike.
